definition: to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: We will help the people in that rebellion.
Mr Mubarak stood down in February after a popular uprising against his rule.
sentences.chinese: 穆巴拉克站在二月下來後對他的統治的人民起義。

sentences.english: The Middle East and North Africa are being swept by popular uprisings.
sentences.chinese: 人民起義正席捲中東和北非。

sentences.english: Popular uprisings are clarifying events, and so it is with the revolt in Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 人民起義是澄清事件，而在埃及，與之相伴的是反抗。
